roleset.name: put (money) in the bank
roleset.note: BANK-V NOTES: Frames file for 'bank' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entry 9.10, Framenet entry Placing. Frames file for 'bank' based on sentences in ectb 2. Verbnet entry 70; other framed members include bet, count, depend, figure, reckon, rely. Comparison with 'count', 'depend', 'rely'. (from bank.01-v predicate notes)
BANKING-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry bank.01, OntoNotes grouping banking-n sense 2; maps to VN class pocket-9.10. Framed by Claire. (from banking.01-n)

example.name: no mention of bank
example.text: What do you say we all close down the poker game, go home and bank the $ 16 billion *U* ?

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1 and ARG2
example.text: I 'm not banking my whole life on bringing , you know , number one rated show .
example.arg: on bringing , you know , number one rated show

example.name: LOC only
example.text: Online banking is simple and convenient.

example.name: ARG2
example.text: Mr. Russo , 38 years old , previously was first vice president , public affairs and advertising , at the banking unit .

example.name: "With" alternant, arg 2
example.text: Banking with ING is extremely frustrating.

roleset.name: turn like an airplane
roleset.note: BANK-V NOTES: Frames file for 'bank' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entry 9.10, Framenet entry Placing. Frames file for 'bank' based on sentences in ectb 2. Verbnet entry 70; other framed members include bet, count, depend, figure, reckon, rely. Comparison with 'count', 'depend', 'rely'. (from bank.02-v predicate notes)

example.name: I can fly!
example.text: John banked the plane into the wind.

roleset.name: rely, depend, bet, take for granted
roleset.note: BANK-V NOTES: Frame created by Arrick (from bank.04-v)

example.name: args 0, 1
example.text: He said we 'll not make reservations but we will make plans etc but *PRO* not to bank on it .

roleset.name: create an embankment
roleset.note: BANK_UP-V NOTES: could also be nonphrasal (from bank.03-v)

example.name: no creator
example.text: It was a long, low room, like a root cellar, for [it]*-1 was banked [*-1]up with soil, and vines had run [*-2] rampant over that, too.
